data.title: A good way to learn some Loveland history
data.text: Exhibits change throughout, watch for the ones that interest you. The museum traces the history of Loveland and the beet industry.

data.title: Quite a surprise
data.text:
We drove over from visiting Estes park to Loveland. Imagine our surprise to find a Picasso, Matisse, Miro, exhibit. Nice exhibit . The cost $5.  They also had a Dali exhibit. 
Check this place out if you will be in the area!

data.title: A gem of a museum
data.text:
If you enjoy a trip back in time, this is a museum for you. The Loveland museum does have featured renowned artists, but for this writer it was the town story and it's industry that captivated.

Suffice it to say it was educational, but more was the sense of being back in the 19th and early 20th century. The displays are amazingly engaging. The cost of this experience is zero. Yes, for the featured world renowned touring artist series there is a modest fee, but for the excursion of exploring the city's past, nada. 

This writer was so dumbfounded by the first experience, he returned days later and sure enough had the same transporting experience. Great fun.

data.title: Miro, Picasso, Matisse, Chagall, and Dali...in Loveland???
data.text: I lived in Loveland 40 years ago and there was no Loveland Museum. It was a sleepy retirement town with two major employers, HP and GW Sugar, now both largely gone. However, my how things have changed. Today, I visited Loveland for the first time in many years and stumbled upon the downtown Loveland Museum amid many art galleries and antique stores. A banner above the museum door said "Picasso, Chagall, Matisse, Miro." "In Loveland???" I wondered. In I went. Admission to the museum is free but the special art exhibit cost $5 for entry. I paid it quickly and inside I found a private collection of great art on display with easily more than 100 unique pieces of artwork and sculpture by these great artists plus Dali (my personal favorite). This is a limited exhibition, so go now. The rest of the museum is also pretty interesting with artifacts documenting early life in Loveland plus a section on GW Sugar. The plaque commemorating the opening of the museum lists a few of my friends, lost to me over the decades but there on the wall in cast bronze letters.

data.title: A great place to see art, and learn about Loveland
data.text: The Art Gallery at the Museum changes and brings in great exhibits.  A nice way to spend some time and enjoy great works.  Be sure to bring in folks from out of town to view the history of Loveland.

data.title: Good option to take visitorsw
data.text: The Loveland Museum has an interesting display about local history and also had special exhibits. Nice place to take out of town visitors.

data.title: Superb Local History Museum (with a side of Art)
data.text:
Don't miss the Loveland Museum!  We stopped by on a Sunday and enjoyed our immersion into Loveland's past.  We learned the importance sugar beets played in the growth and development of the area.  We also wandered through various exhibits, going room to room ("building to building") visiting a blacksmith shop, a jail, a general store, a doctor's office, hotel, and many more .  A fantastic learning experience that was totally free.  

The Gallery portion included several interesting art galleries, though the main exhibit was closed temporarily due to a transition of exhibits.  Please note, that had it been open, the main art gallery does have an entrance fee.

data.title: A great place for art
data.text: The standing exhibits at the museum are worth seeing every time you visit and the featured, rotating exhibits are generally as good as any you will anywhere. It's a good mix of traditional and contemporary; local and national artists.

data.title: Always something interesting to see
data.text: Lots of interesting artwork passes through the Loveland Museum/Gallery each season. Watch for the "free" admission days in the LRH and online. Also a good place to find thoughtful and unique gifts for purchase.

data.title: Best Bargain in Town
data.text: Such a well-done museum with friendly attendants and a few quality, appropriate gifts items for sale.  Some rotating exhibits and some classics.  You will learn about the beginnings of Loveland and the Big Thompson River corridor, see some vignettes of historical past and an interesting exhibit on the process of extracting sugar from the sugar beet, a part of Loveland's past and a present day landmark.  Don't miss the Loveland Valentine stamp exhibit, which was missing stamps for some dates, sadly.  Free.  Closes early.  Entry fee for the gallery.

data.title: Local Culture in Loveland, Colorado
data.text:
The Loveland Museum is a do not miss hit in Loveland, Colorado.
If you are a visitor or just as importantly, a resident of Loveland you need to vist the museum.
There you will learn the history of not only Loveland but the surrounding area..It is one of the best small town museums in the country.

data.title: a true gem in the heart of a small town
data.text: The Loveland Museum has excellent history displays, and the gallery/art shows rival any in the region.  The staff is terrific and there is always a good event happening there.  Don't miss this wonderful facility.

data.title: Well done. History and art
data.text: Very good museum. Definitely not a typical small town tourist catcher. Worthy of the title museum. We'll thought out. Professionally presented. Kid friendly, but quality history and educational exhibits. Great staff. Worth the stop!!!

data.title: Nice displays
data.text: Focused on the history of the Loveland area.  Had several interesting displays.  Video about blacksmith making horseshoes was worthwhile watching.  Good place to spend up to an hour if you like history.

data.title: Great glimpse of our areas history
data.text: This is a great local museum.  Displays are fun!  It is a rather quick walk through that is totally enjoyable.

data.title: What a treasure!
data.text: I love visiting the Loveland Museum and Gallery because its special.  The exhibits are outstanding; interesting and captivating.  Staff there love the place and make sure you feel their passion for art and history of the region.  I have even had the pleasure of conducting a Martin Luther King program there during their Historical Thursdays Series.  I go back each year for the Governor's Art Show and other events such as the Legendary Ladies program held on Historical Thursdays in March just a few weeks ago.  Art be it sculpture, paintings, etc. reigns supreme in Loveland.  Certainly the Loveland Museum/Gallery more than upholds its end of the bargain!

data.title: Outstanding museum and gallery
data.text: We love the museum which is very easy to get downtown. Recently, we went to the Momentum Exhibit. Glad we didn't miss this one. Five local women sculptors display their beautiful work. Can't wait for the next exhibit.

data.title: Exceptional
data.text: Unexpected tor a small town to have such a wonderful museum. The permanent displays are extraordinary. The main gallery has changing displays which are of amazing quality. The place is historical, artistic & absolutely fascinating. You will enjoy it. It's just great for the whole family.

data.title: Always fun to visit.  Lots to see.
data.text: The permanent displays are always interesting for old and young alike.  A neat way to learn the history of the area.  But, this time we wanted to see the collection of Christo & Jeanne-Claude drawings of their monumental installations around  the world.  It was unbelievable, and the docent's input made it all the more enjoyable.  How great to have an exhibit of this caliber here for almost three months.

data.title: A great way to learn about the history of Loveland
data.text:
We were there for an event. We did get a chance to look at the museum and it is a fun way to travel back in time to see what Loveland used to be like.
Upstairs kids can use the Loveland rubber stamps that they use for the valentines every year, to make their own creations.
